New Records: Luis Gil pitched 6 scoreless innings, allowing only one hit, the lowest since July 13 and his first time going at least six innings since then
Key Match Events: Aaron Judge doubled to score the first run in the third inning
Austin Wells drove in two runs with a single but was later picked off and tagged out
New York's bullpen pitched scoreless innings to close the game
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees needed a strong performance from Luis Gil after a series loss to the Texas Rangers
New York loaded the bases in the first inning but couldn't score
Anthony Rizzo received a warm welcome from the Wrigley Field crowd in his first at-bat for the Yankees
Post-Match Reflections: Luis Gil was named the MVP for his strong performance
The Yankees' bullpen performed well after losing closer Clay Holmes earlier in the week
Miscellaneous Highlights: The series continued with another game on Saturday
Clarke Schmidt was set to return from the IL for the next game
